Text: SHORT TITLE. This Act may be cited as the ‘‘Clean Commute for Kids Act of 2021’’.
Keywords: act, cited, clean, commute

Text: CLEAN SCHOOL BUS PROGRAM.
Keywords: clean, school, bus, program

Text: IN GENERAL.—Section 741 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16091) is amended to read as follows:
Keywords: energy, policy, act, u.s.c, amended, follows

Text: CLEAN SCHOOL BUS PROGRAM.
Keywords: clean, school, bus, program

Text: DEFINITIONS.—In this section:
Keywords: definitions

Text: ADMINISTRATOR.—The term ‘Administrator’ means the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency.
Keywords: administrator, term, environmental, protection, agency

Text: CLEAN SCHOOL BUS.—The term ‘clean school bus’ means a school bus with a drivetrain that produces, under any possible operational mode or condition, zero exhaust emissions of—
Keywords: clean, school, bus, term, drivetrain, produces, possible, operational, mode, condition, zero, exhaust, emissions

Text: any air pollutant that is listed pursuant to section 108(a) of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7408(a)) (or any precursor to such an air pollutant); and
Keywords: air, pollutant, pursuant, clean, act, u.s.c, precursor

Text: any greenhouse gas.
Keywords: greenhouse, gas

Text: COMMUNITY OF COLOR.—The term ‘community of color’ means any geographically distinct area the population of color of which is higher than the average population of color of the State in which the community is located.
Keywords: community, term, geographically, distinct, area, population, average, state, located

Text: ELIGIBLE CONTRACTOR.—The term ‘eligible contractor’ means a contractor that is a for-profit, not-for-profit, or nonprofit entity that has the capacity—
Keywords: eligible, contractor, term, profit, nonprofit, entity, capacity

Text: to sell clean school buses, or charging or other equipment needed to charge or maintain clean school buses, to individuals or entities that own a school bus or fleet of school buses; or
Keywords: sell, clean, school, buses, charging, equipment, needed, charge, maintain, individuals, entities, bus, fleet

Text: to arrange financing for a sale described in subparagraph (A).
Keywords: arrange, financing, sale, described, subparagraph

Text: ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT.—
Keywords: eligible, recipient

Text: IN GENERAL.—Subject to subparagraph (B), the term ‘eligible recipient’ means—
Keywords: subject, subparagraph, term, eligible, recipient

Text: 1 or more local or State governmental entities responsible for—
Keywords: local, state, governmental, entities, responsible

Text: providing school bus service to 1 or more public school systems; or
Keywords: providing, school, bus, service, public, systems

Text: the purchase of school buses;
Keywords: purchase, school, buses

Text: a tribally controlled school (as defined in section 5212 of the Tribally Controlled Schools Act of 1988 (25 U.S.C. 2511));
Keywords: tribally, controlled, school, defined, schools, act, u.s.c

Text: a nonprofit school transportation association; or
Keywords: nonprofit, school, transportation, association

Text: 1 or more contracting entities that provide school bus service to 1 or more public school systems.
Keywords: contracting, entities, school, bus, service, public, systems

Text: SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS.—In the case of eligible recipients described in clauses (iii) and (iv) of subparagraph (A), the Administrator—
Keywords: special, requirements, case, eligible, recipients, described, clauses

Text: shall establish timely and appropriate requirements for notice to the public school systems that would be served by school buses purchased using an award under subsection (b)(1); and
Keywords: establish, timely, appropriate, requirements, notice, public, school, systems, served, buses, purchased, award, subsection

Text: may establish timely and appropriate requirements for approval by the public school systems that would be served by school buses purchased using an award under subsection (b)(1).
Keywords: establish, timely, appropriate, requirements, approval, public, school, systems, served, buses, purchased, award, subsection

Text: INDIGENOUS COMMUNITY.—The term ‘indigenous community’ means—
Keywords: indigenous, community, term

Text: a federally recognized Indian Tribe;
Keywords: federally, recognized, indian, tribe

Text: a State-recognized Indian Tribe;
Keywords: state, recognized, indian, tribe

Text: an Alaska Native or Native Hawaiian community or organization; or
Keywords: alaska, native, hawaiian, community, organization

Text: any other community of indigenous people, including communities in other countries.
Keywords: community, indigenous, communities, countries

Text: LOW INCOME.—The term ‘low income’ means an annual household income equal to, or less than, the greater of—
Keywords: income, term, annual, household, equal, greater

Text: an amount equal to 80 percent of the median income of the area in which the household is located, as reported by the Department of Housing and Urban Development; and
Keywords: amount, equal, median, income, area, household, located, reported, department, housing, urban, development

Text: 200 percent of the Federal poverty line.
Keywords: federal, poverty, line

Text: LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY.—The term ‘low-income community’ means any census block group in which 30 percent or more of the population are individuals with low income.
Keywords: income, community, term, census, block, group, population, individuals

Text: SCHOOL BUS.—The term ‘school bus’ has the meaning given the term ‘schoolbus’ in section 30125(a) of title 49, United States Code.
Keywords: school, bus, term, meaning, schoolbus, united, states, code

Text: SCRAP.—
Keywords: scrap

Text: IN GENERAL.—The term ‘scrap’, with respect to a school bus engine replaced using an award under subsection (b)(1), means to recycle, crush, or shred the engine within such period and in such manner as determined by the Administrator.
Keywords: term, scrap, respect, school, bus, engine, replaced, award, subsection, recycle, crush, shred, period, manner, determined, administrator

Text: EXCLUSION.—The term ‘scrap’ does not include selling, leasing, exchanging, or otherwise disposing of an engine described in subparagraph (A) for use in another motor vehicle in any location.
Keywords: exclusion, term, scrap, selling, leasing, exchanging, otherwise, disposing, engine, described, subparagraph, motor, vehicle

Text: PROGRAM FOR REPLACEMENT OF EXISTING SCHOOL BUSES WITH CLEAN SCHOOL BUSES.—
Keywords: program, replacement, existing, school, buses, clean

Text: ESTABLISHMENT.—The Administrator, in consultation with the Secretary, shall establish a program for—
Keywords: establishment, administrator, consultation, secretary, establish, program

Text: making awards, on a competitive basis, of grants, rebates, and low-cost revolving loans to eligible recipients for the replacement of existing school buses that are not clean school buses with clean school buses; and
Keywords: awards, competitive, basis, grants, rebates, cost, revolving, loans, eligible, recipients, replacement, existing, school, buses, clean

Text: making awards of contracts to eligible contractors for providing rebates and lowcost revolving loans for the replacement of existing school buses that are not clean school buses with clean school buses.
Keywords: awards, contracts, eligible, contractors, providing, rebates, lowcost, revolving, loans, replacement, existing, school, buses, clean

Text: APPLICATIONS.—
Keywords: applications

Text: IN GENERAL.—An applicant for an award under paragraph (1) shall submit to the Administrator an application at such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the Administrator may require, including—
Keywords: applicant, award, submit, administrator, application, manner, containing, information, require

Text: a written assurance that—
Keywords: assurance

Text: all laborers and mechanics employed by contractors or subcontractors during construction, alteration, or repair, or at any manufacturing operation, that is financed, in whole or in part, by an award under paragraph (1), shall be paid wages at rates not less than those prevailing in a similar firm or on similar construction in the locality, as determined by the Secretary of Labor in accordance with subchapter IV of chapter 31 of title 40, United States Code; and
Keywords: laborers, mechanics, employed, contractors, subcontractors, construction, alteration, repair, manufacturing, operation, financed, award, paid, wages, rates, prevailing, firm, locality, determined, secretary, labor, accordance, iv, united, states, code

Text: the applicant agrees to the authority of the Secretary of Labor described in subparagraph (B);
Keywords: applicant, agrees, authority, secretary, labor, described, subparagraph

Text: a certification that no public work or service normally performed by a public employee will be privatized or subcontracted in carrying out a project funded by the award;
Keywords: certification, public, work, service, normally, performed, employee, privatized, subcontracted, carrying, project, funded, award

Text: to ensure a fair assessment of workforce impact related to an award under paragraph (1), a detailed accounting with respect to relevant employees, including employees in each of management, administration, operations, and maintenance, of the eligible recipient at the time of the application, including—
Keywords: ensure, fair, assessment, workforce, impact, related, award, detailed, accounting, respect, relevant, employees, management, administration, operations, maintenance, eligible, recipient, application

Text: the number of employees, organized by salary;
Keywords: number, employees, organized, salary

Text: the bargaining unit status of each employee;
Keywords: bargaining, unit, status, employee

Text: the full-time or part-time status of each employee; and
Keywords: status, employee

Text: the job title of each employee; and
Keywords: job, employee

Text: a description of coordination and advance planning with the local electricity provider.
Keywords: description, coordination, advance, planning, local, electricity, provider

Text: AUTHORITY OF SECRETARY OF LABOR.—For any project or activity carried out by a recipient of an award under paragraph (1), the Secretary of Labor shall, with respect to the labor standards described in subparagraph (A)(i)(I), have the authority and functions set forth in Reorganization Plan Numbered 14 of 1950 (64 Stat. 1267; 5 U.S.C. App.) and section 3145 of title 40, United States Code.
Keywords: authority, secretary, labor, project, activity, carried, recipient, award, respect, standards, described, subparagraph

Text: ELIGIBLE MANUFACTURERS.—
Keywords: eligible, manufacturers

Text: IN GENERAL.—The Administrator shall maintain and make publicly available a list of manufacturers of clean school buses from whom recipients of awards under paragraph (1) may purchase clean school buses.
Keywords: administrator, maintain, publicly, available, manufacturers, clean, school, buses, whom, recipients, awards, purchase

Text: CRITERIA.—The Administrator shall establish a process by which manufacturers may seek inclusion on the list established under subparagraph (A), which shall include the submission of such information as the Administrator may require, including—
Keywords: criteria, administrator, establish, process, manufacturers, seek, inclusion, established, subparagraph, submission, information, require

Text: a disclosure of whether there has been any administrative merits determination, arbitral award or decision, or civil judgment, as defined in guidance issued by the Secretary of Labor, rendered against the manufacturer in the preceding 3 years for violations of applicable labor, employment, civil rights, or health and safety laws; and
Keywords: disclosure, administrative, merits, determination, arbitral, award, decision, civil, judgment, defined, guidance, issued, secretary, labor, rendered, manufacturer, preceding, years, violations, applicable, employment, rights, health, safety, laws

Text: specific information regarding—
Keywords: information, regarding

Text: the actions the manufacturer will take to demonstrate compliance with and, where possible, exceedance of, requirements under applicable labor, employment, civil rights, and health and safety laws; and
Keywords: actions, manufacturer, demonstrate, compliance, possible, exceedance, requirements, applicable, labor, employment, civil, rights, health, safety, laws

Text: actions the manufacturer will take to ensure that the direct suppliers of the manufacturer demonstrate compliance with applicable labor, employment, civil rights, and health and safety laws.
Keywords: actions, manufacturer, ensure, direct, suppliers, demonstrate, compliance, applicable, labor, employment, civil, rights, health, safety, laws

Text: PRIORITY OF APPLICATIONS.—
Keywords: priority, applications

Text: HIGHEST PRIORITY.—In making awards under paragraph (1), the Administrator shall give highest priority to applicants that propose to replace school buses that serve the highest number of students (measured in absolute numbers or in the percentage of student population) who are eligible for free or reduced price lunches under the Richard B. Russell National School Lunch Act (42 U.S.C. 1751 et seq.).
Keywords: highest, priority, awards, administrator, applicants, propose, replace, school, buses, serve, number, students, measured, absolute, numbers, percentage, student, population, eligible, reduced, price, lunches, richard, russell, national, lunch, act, u.s.c, seq

Text: ADDITIONAL PRIORITY.—In making awards under paragraph (1), after taking into account the priority described in subparagraph (A), the Administrator shall give priority to applicants that propose to complement the assistance received through the award by securing additional sources of funding for the activities supported through the award, such as through—
Keywords: priority, awards, taking, account, described, subparagraph

Text: public-private partnerships with electric companies;
Keywords: public, private, partnerships, electric, companies

Text: grants from other entities; or
Keywords: grants, entities

Text: the issuance of school bonds.
Keywords: issuance, school, bonds

Text: USE OF SCHOOL BUS FLEET.—All clean school buses purchased with an award under paragraph (1) shall—
Keywords: school, bus, fleet, clean, buses, purchased, award

Text: be operated as part of the school bus fleet for which the award was made for not less than 5 years;
Keywords: operated, school, bus, fleet, award, years

Text: be maintained, operated, charged, and fueled according to manufacturer recommendations or State requirements; and
Keywords: maintained, operated, charged, fueled, according, manufacturer, recommendations, state, requirements

Text: not be manufactured or retrofitted with, or otherwise have installed, a power unit or other technology that creates air pollution within the school bus, such as an unvented diesel passenger heater.
Keywords: manufactured, retrofitted, otherwise, installed, power, unit, technology, creates, air, pollution, school, bus, unvented, diesel, passenger, heater

Text: AWARDS.—
Keywords: awards

Text: AWARD AMOUNT.—
Keywords: award, amount

Text: IN GENERAL.—Subject to clause (ii) and subparagraph (D), the Administrator may make an award under paragraph (1) in an amount not more than the amount that is 100 percent of the replacement costs for clean school buses.
Keywords: subject, clause

Text: LIMITATION.—The replacement costs described in clause (i) shall not exceed an amount equal to 110 percent of the difference between—
Keywords: limitation, replacement, costs, described, clause, exceed, amount, equal, difference

Text: the cost of a clean school bus; and
Keywords: cost, clean, school, bus

Text: the cost of a diesel school bus.
Keywords: cost, diesel, school, bus

Text: STRUCTURING AWARDS.—In making an award under paragraph (1)(A), the Administrator shall decide whether to award a grant, rebate, or low-cost revolving loan, or a combination thereof, based primarily on—
Keywords: structuring, awards, award, administrator, decide, grant, rebate, cost, revolving, loan, combination, thereof, primarily

Text: how best to facilitate replacing existing school buses that are not clean school buses with clean school buses; and
Keywords: facilitate, replacing, existing, school, buses, clean

Text: the preference of the eligible recipient.
Keywords: preference, eligible, recipient

Text: INCLUDED COSTS.—An award under paragraph (1) may be used to pay for—
Keywords: included, costs, award

Text: acquisition and labor costs for charging or other infrastructure needed to charge or maintain clean school buses;
Keywords: acquisition, labor, costs, charging, infrastructure, needed, charge, maintain, clean, school, buses

Text: workforce development and training to support the maintenance, charging, and operations of electric school buses; and
Keywords: workforce, development, training, support, maintenance, charging, operations, electric, school, buses

Text: planning and technical activities to support the adoption and deployment of clean school buses.
Keywords: planning, technical, activities, support, adoption, deployment, clean, school, buses

Text: EXCEPTION FOR CONTRACTING ENTITIES.—
Keywords: exception, contracting, entities

Text: IN GENERAL.—Subject to clause (ii), in the case of an award under paragraph (1) to an eligible recipient described in subsection (a)(5)(A)(iv), the Administrator may make an award for up to 70 percent of the replacement costs for clean school buses.
Keywords: subject, clause

Text: EXCEPTION.—If an eligible recipient described in subsection (a)(5)(A)(iv) demonstrates, to the satisfaction of the Administrator, that the labor standards of the eligible recipient are equal to or exceed those of the public school system that would be served by the clean school buses purchased with an award under paragraph (1), the Administrator may make an award to the eligible recipient for up to 90 percent of the replacement costs for clean school buses.
Keywords: exception, eligible, recipient, described, subsection

Text: REQUIREMENTS.—The Administrator shall require, as a condition of receiving an award under paragraph (1), that an award recipient—
Keywords: requirements, administrator, require, condition, receiving, award, recipient

Text: does not, as a result of receiving the award—
Keywords: receiving, award

Text: lay off, transfer, or demote any current employee; or
Keywords: lay, transfer, demote, employee

Text: reduce the salary or benefits of any current employee or worsen the conditions of work of any current employee; and
Keywords: reduce, salary, benefits, employee, worsen, conditions, work

Text: provides current employees with training to effectively operate, maintain, or otherwise adapt to new technologies relating to clean school buses.
Keywords: employees, training, effectively, operate, maintain, otherwise, adapt, new, technologies, relating, clean, school, buses

Text: BUY AMERICA.—
Keywords: america

Text: IN GENERAL.—Except as provided in clause (ii), any clean school bus or electric vehicle supply equipment purchased using an award under paragraph
Keywords: except, clause, clean, school, bus, electric, vehicle, supply, equipment, purchased, award

Text: shall comply with section 5323(j) of title 49, United States Code.
Keywords: comply, united, states, code

Text: EXCEPTIONS.—
Keywords: exceptions

Text: WAIVER.—Subject to subclause (II), the Administrator may provide a waiver to the requirements described in clause (i) in the same manner and to the same extent as the Secretary of Transportation may provide a waiver under section 5323(j)(2) of title 49, United States Code.
Keywords: waiver, subject, subclause, administrator, requirements, described, clause, manner, extent, secretary, transportation, united, states, code

Text: PERCENTAGE OF COMPONENTS AND SUBCOMPONENTS.—The Administrator may grant a waiver in accordance with section 5323(j)(2)(C) of title 49, United States Code, when an award recipient purchases a clean school bus or electric vehicle supply equipment using an award under paragraph (1) for which the cost of components and subcomponents produced in the United States—
Keywords: percentage, components, subcomponents, administrator, grant, waiver, accordance, united, states, code, award, recipient, purchases, clean, school, bus, electric, vehicle, supply, equipment, cost, produced

Text: for each of fiscal years 2021 through 2025, is more than 60 percent of the cost of all components of the clean school bus; and
Keywords: fiscal, years, cost, components, clean, school, bus

Text: for fiscal year 2025 and each fiscal year thereafter, is more than 70 percent of the cost of all components of the clean school bus. (7) DEPLOYMENT AND DISTRIBUTION.—The Administrator shall—
Keywords: fiscal, thereafter, cost, components, clean, school, bus

Text: workforce development and training; and
Keywords: workforce, development, training

Text: any other information that, in the judgment of the Administrator, is relevant to transitioning to and deploying clean school buses; (E) make available the information provided by the Secretary pursuant to subsection
Keywords: information, judgment, administrator, relevant, transitioning, deploying, clean, school, buses

Text: with the Administrator.
Keywords: administrator

Text: TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE.—The Secretary shall, in response to a request from the Administrator, or from an applicant for or recipient of an award under subsection (b)(1), provide technical assistance in the development of an application for or the use of an award under subsection (b)(1). (e) ANNUAL REPORT.—Not later than January 31 of each year after a year for which funds were appropriated to carry out this section, the Administrator shall submit to Congress a report that—
Keywords: technical, assistance, secretary, response, request, administrator, applicant, recipient, award, subsection, development, application

Text: the total number of applications received for awards under subsection (b)(1);
Keywords: total, number, applications, awards, subsection

Text: the number of clean school buses requested in the applications described in subparagraph (A);
Keywords: number, clean, school, buses, requested, applications, described, subparagraph

Text: the awards made under subsection (b)(1) and the criteria used to select the award recipients;
Keywords: awards, subsection

Text: the awards made under subsection (b)(1) for charging and fueling infrastructure;
Keywords: awards, subsection

Text: ongoing compliance with the commitments made by manufacturers on the list maintained by the Administrator under subsection (b)(3)(A);
Keywords: ongoing, compliance, commitments, manufacturers, maintained, administrator, subsection

Text: the estimated effect of the awards under subsection (b)(1) on emission of air pollutants, including greenhouse gases; and
Keywords: estimated, effect, awards, subsection, emission, air, pollutants, greenhouse, gases

Text: any other information the Administrator considers appropriate; and
Keywords: information, administrator, considers, appropriate

Text: describes any waiver granted under subsection (b)(6)(F)(ii) during the preceding year. (f) AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS.—
Keywords: describes, waiver, granted, subsection, preceding

Text: ALLOCATION.—Of the amount made available under paragraph (1) for a fiscal year, not less than $1,000,000,000 shall be used for awards under subsection (b)(1) to eligible recipients proposing to replace school buses that serve a community of color, an indigenous community, a low-income community, or a community located in an air quality area designated pursuant to section 107 of the Clean Air Act (42 U.S.C. 7407) as nonattainment.
Keywords: allocation, amount, available, fiscal, 1,000,000,000, awards, subsection, eligible, recipients, proposing, replace, school, buses, serve, community, indigenous, income, located, air, quality, area, designated, pursuant, clean, act, u.s.c, nonattainment

Text: ADMINISTRATIVE COSTS.—Of the amounts made available under paragraph (1) for a fiscal year, the Administrator may use not more than 2 percent for the administrative costs of carrying out this section.’’.
Keywords: administrative, costs, amounts, available, fiscal, administrator, carrying

Text: REPEAL OF REDUNDANT AUTHORIZATION.—
Keywords: repeal, redundant, authorization

Text: IN GENERAL.—Section 6015 of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users (42 U.S.C. 16091a) is repealed.
Keywords: safe, accountable, flexible, efficient, transportation, equity, act, legacy, users, u.s.c, 16091a, repealed

Text: CONFORMING AMENDMENT.—The table of contents in section 1(b) of the Safe, Accountable, Flexible, Efficient Transportation Equity Act: A Legacy for Users (Public Law 109–59; 119 Stat. 1144) is amended by striking the item relating to section 6015.
Keywords: conforming, amendment, table, contents, safe, accountable, flexible, efficient, transportation, equity, act, legacy, users, public, law, stat, amended, striking, relating
